long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Allows you to type accents like you would on a macbook, by simply pressing and holding on your desired character, then pressing the associated number key with the popup that appears. This is designed for Windows machines, but should also work on linux. Works best if you do the following:
  -Set repeat delay to the longest possible
  -Set repeat rate to the slowest possible
You can do this in Windows control panel, under keyboard settings.
